programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Fearless wildlife zoologist Jack Randall dives head first into a marine mystery: are majestic green sea turtles adapting to the devastating conditions of Australia‚Äôs dying Great Barrier Reef? While joining forces with a dedicated team of daring scientists, Jack dodges bull rays, snatches nurse sharks and wrangles dugongs.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Zoologist Jack Randall explores Australia‚Äôs remote Cape York peninsula to confront five of the most venomous snakes in the world, including the elusive Coastal Taipan. Along the way, Jack encounters huge pythons and terrifying tarantulas and joins forces with a local wildlife legend to determine which is the deadliest snake ‚Äúdown under.‚Äù.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: The Real Black Panther
programme.desc: There's a new challenger in the Kabini Forest of India, one unlike all leopards that came before him. This is the story of Saya, the real black panther, and his rise to power..

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Fearless wildlife zoologist Jack Randall dives head first into a marine mystery: are majestic green sea turtles adapting to the devastating conditions of Australia‚Äôs dying Great Barrier Reef? While joining forces with a dedicated team of daring scientists, Jack dodges bull rays, snatches nurse sharks and wrangles dugongs.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Zoologist Jack Randall explores Australia‚Äôs remote Cape York peninsula to confront five of the most venomous snakes in the world, including the elusive Coastal Taipan. Along the way, Jack encounters huge pythons and terrifying tarantulas and joins forces with a local wildlife legend to determine which is the deadliest snake ‚Äúdown under.‚Äù.

programme.title: Prairie Dog Manor
programme.desc: After 4 months of hibernation, the male prairie dogs in northern New Mexico emerge. While the females continue to sleep in the burrows, the males compete for supremacy outside. .

programme.title: Prairie Dog Manor
programme.desc: The warm weather has officially overtaken Northern New Mexico and that means it's officially mating season! In the Flatlands, Furgie must battle Brutus, once again, for the right to mate with a female that lives within the Alpha Dog's territory.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: In Africa's vast Serengeti Plain, one million wildebeest are taking a rare pause for the mothers to have their young in a massive birthing event. .

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: When you've got it all, why would you give it all up? We expect animals to take the path of least resistance -- choosing the easiest and surest ways to get food, safety and comfort. But animals aren't always so predictable.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Nigel Marven explores the stunningly beautiful country of Guatemala, uncovering a wealth of wildlife, dramatic scenery and ancient Maya history along the way. Join him to see the world's most beautiful lake, Central America's most colourful pitviper and incredible views from the 'top of the Maya world'. There are Quetzals, jays and orchids in the cloud forests and venomous lizards in the arid interior.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Join affable presenter Nigel Marven as he discovers the colourful and varied wildlife of Costa Rica. Meet Scarlet Macaws on the Osa Peninsula, playful Spotted Dolphins in the Gulf of Dulce, a 'Christmas Tree' Eyelash Palm Pitviper, baby Leatherback Turtles on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast and a group of colourful kings in the north of the country.

programme.title: Return Of The Predators
programme.desc: After 30 years of war and destruction, Gorongosa National Park in Mozambique has undergone a remarkable restoration. Herbivores once again bound across the plains, but hunters have been slower to return, leaving the park out of balance..until now!.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Nigel Marven explores the stunningly beautiful country of Guatemala, uncovering a wealth of wildlife, dramatic scenery and ancient Maya history along the way. Join him to see the world's most beautiful lake, Central America's most colourful pitviper and incredible views from the 'top of the Maya world'. There are Quetzals, jays and orchids in the cloud forests and venomous lizards in the arid interior.

programme.title: Wild Central America
programme.desc: Join affable presenter Nigel Marven as he discovers the colourful and varied wildlife of Costa Rica. Meet Scarlet Macaws on the Osa Peninsula, playful Spotted Dolphins in the Gulf of Dulce, a 'Christmas Tree' Eyelash Palm Pitviper, baby Leatherback Turtles on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast and a group of colourful kings in the north of the country.

programme.title: Ten Deadliest Snakes
programme.desc: From the wetlands of Rio Grande to the mighty Amazon rainforest, Brazil is a hotspot for deadly snakes and Nigel is seeking them out as he counts down his top ten. Found only on the tiny 'Snake Island', there's only a few hundred Golden Lanceheads in the world. But can they beat the snake responsible for many human bites, the jararaca, to the top spot?

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol has helped kids show animals at the county fair for more than 40 years. For some families, its a tradition going back generations. Raising fair animals takes months of work, and it all pays off at showtime! At the clinic, Doc helps a limping steer with a swollen leg, Dr. Brenda treats a urinary blockage that threatens a cats kidneys, and Dr. Lisa bandages a wounded dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol & Diane welcome a new Friesian filly to the family. Dr. Lisa handles two Corgi emergencies, and Dr. Olivia gets help treating two dogs with curious wounds. Doc treats a mini horse with excessive thirst and a chicken with a paralyzed crop. An emotional support rabbit needs a checkup before heading off to college, and clinic staffer, Hilary, brings in one of her own dogs for veterinary care. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol welcomes a new vet to the clinic just in time to help the team with a wave of cases. Dr. Pol treats a local K9 deputys injured paw, Dr. Nicole examines a service dog after a scuffle, Dr. Lisa stitches up a horse with a large laceration, and Dr. Brenda soothes a cats burned limb. On her second day on the job, Dr. Olivia jumps into action and helps Dr. Lisa with a cow in labor. .

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The killer whale is the world's biggest dolphin-32 feet long and up to six tons heavy. Smart, sophisticated, and social, they live in groups and hunt cooperatively. But it's no natural born killer. Calves spend several years at their mother's side, learning how to hunt some of the smallest-and biggest-animals in the sea. Built for the Kill: Killer Whale exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The big bad wolf is 100 pounds of muscle and teeth, but it's born blind, deaf and weighs just one pound. Built for the Kill: Wolf follows the transformation of a helpless pup into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The wolf hones its hunting skills over about two years of intensive training-and the lessons are hard.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The polar bear is the world's largest land predator-but it's born blind and deaf. How does a helpless cub become a successful killer? Built for the Kill: Polar Bear exposes real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. The cub spends about three years at its mother's side, learning to navigate the harsh Arctic environment. .

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The crocodile is the world's largest reptilian predator, but it takes years of intensive training to learn to be lethal. It enters the world as a replica of its adult form, only four thousand times smaller. Built for the Kill: Crocodile follows the transformation of a tiny hatchling into an accomplished killer, exposing real life-and-death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The hyena, much maligned and misunderstood, is no slobbering scavenger. It's a calculating killer: as smart as a primate, as lethal as a lion. Built for the Kill: Hyena follows the transformation of a tiny cub into an accomplished hunter; exposing real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. .

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the constant heat, humidity and rainfall of the Australian rainforests to find out what it takes to be ‚ÄúBuilt to Survive.‚Äù In the leafy canopy, Phil encounters the elusive tree kangaroo and its young joey, as well as Australia‚Äôs largest snake, the lethal scrub python. On the forest floor, the colorful cassowary acts as the rainforest‚Äôs gardener.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin ventures into Australia‚Äôs notorious wetlands to discover three animals built for the muggy and wet environment. Phil comes face to face with the uniquely Australian freshwater crocodile, a massive predatory fish called the barramundi, and the saltwater crocodile, one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals and largest reptiles.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Ultimate Rivals: Cats vs Dogs
programme.desc: Canines and felines have been living side by side in Africa for hundreds of thousands of years, and they've never really gotten along-not even amongst themselves. Throw the hyena into the mix and they're all nightmare neighbors? Stealing from each other; harassing each other; eating each other's young. Avoidance might be the only way to stay alive. Cats, dogs and the wild-card hyena, all jousting in a free for all for survival.
